Topic.Title: Tonight is Lobster Night at the Petroleum Club

Message.Msg: Several great ideas came out after the feast of lobsters. BTW Main lobsters usually have sweeter meat than the Australian Rock lobster but our chef does some things with Louisiana crab boil seasoning that makes them almost indistinguishable. Back to Preserving and expanding our wealth. The fist suggestion was to buy a couple of politicians – known as the “Warren Buffett method.” Although politicians are relatively inexpensive investments with fantastic returns, most didn’t think it was very sporting. A few thought hoarding more gold and silver was a way to go but most people using gold as a store of value already have plenty and that’s why the price has quit moving even when a new crisis pops up. Several thought we should just be tight fisted with our wealth – Don’t hire “fire and contract.” This is rather cruel but since most of us started with nothing and became very wealthy, we thought it might be entertaining to watch the “have nots” trying to build a “culture of opportunity” through insane regulation and high taxation. Many other ideas were floated but none of them involved letting one legged women make of with half our fortunes.

Message.Title: What's Behind Obama's Obsession Over Raising Taxes
Message.Msg: First … know this. It’s not about raising revenue. It’s about punishing the wealthy. Obama was raised to believe – and believes to this day – that people only become wealthy by oppressing, exploiting and taking advantage of others; unless, of course, you’re an athlete or an entertainer. His obsession over raising taxes on the high-achievers is born of a desire for revenge rather than a need to raise revenue. There was no better illustration of Obama’s obsession for punishing the wealthy than his appearance years ago on Charlie Gibson’s TV show. Obama then, as now, wanted to raise capital gains taxes. Gibson told Obama that history shows that increases in capital gains taxes generally result in a reduction of capital gains tax collections. Obama told Gibson it wasn’t about raising revenue, it was about fairness. Are you hearing this? Obama didn’t care about the revenue! He didn’t even care if the government got LESS revenue. His focus was on making sure that the people who earned that money were forced to give more of it up. Resentment of high achievers is not going to grow our economy and restore America’s economic vitality. Elections have consequences. NBN

Message.Title: You Don't Believe in Government!
Message.Msg: On Friday, I got a call from LC. His phone call started off very reasonable, until he came out with this one line that seems to be pervasive amongst ignorant liberals (redundant?): “You don’t believe in any government.” This is such the standard rhetorical absurdity liberals love to use in response to conservatives, and they use it in response to a breadth of issues. Let’s take healthcare, for example. When conservatives say that they are opposed to ObamaCare – which I promise you are going to hate – generally it is because conservatives support private sector, competitive free market approaches to healthcare instead of more government. So you tell a liberal that this how you think we should solve our healthcare problems in this country and their response generally sounds like this, “Oh, so you don’t want people to have healthcare!” Huh?? Uh, no. Why is it that liberals seem to assume that government and bureaucracy are the only proper ways to provide a service? The private sector can do an even better job of providing this service, yet liberals reduce this down to “Oh, so you don’t want people to have healthcare.” Amazing. The same can be said for environmental policy. If you point out the fact that EPA regulations have gone too far or their application sometimes lack common sense, “Oh, so you are for dirty air! You want dirty water!” That is so typical for how liberals argue with conservatives. And it is this lack of liberal logic which ultimately dooms their success in talk radio. Trust me, I would LOVE to have more competition in talk radio. Heck, I even donated to keep Air America afloat because I truly believe that the more competition the better. But the fact is that the liberals couldn’t compete. Why? Because of their inability to approach a subject logically. They are incapable of discussing legitimate, responsible ways to reduce the role of government so they immediate jump to this idiotic line, “Oh, so you don’t want government .. or you want dirty air.” And after a few days of listening to that nonsense, people simply tune out. They quickly realize that these proggies are #$%$ and thus their liberal talk shows fail. Boortz

Topic.Title: What's Behind Obama's Obsession Over Raising Taxes

Message.Msg: Here is "fairness" then. The debt is about $1.2 trillion/year and the yearly aggregate income in the United Staters, according to the IRS, is about $8 trillion. 1.2/8 = 15%. That is the amount that needs to be added in taxes - across the board - to everyone, from the billionaire at the top of income earning down to the guy who only made $1000. Only the LWNJs - the mathematically impaired - believe that the deficit spending can be resolved by taking it only from the rich. The so-called 1% ($250K and up) only earn $800 billion/year. The solution has to come from EVERYONE - including and especially those that voted for Obama.

Message.Title: Quotes of the Day - Twofer
Message.Msg: Socialism, like the ancient ideas from which it springs, confuses the distinction between government and society. As a result of this, every time we object to a thing being done by government, the socialists conclude that we object to its being done at all. We disapprove of state education. Then the socialists say that we are opposed to any education. We object to a state religion. Then the socialists say that we want no religion at all. We object to a state-enforced equality. Then they say that we are against equality. And so on, and so on. It is as if the socialists were to accuse us of not wanting persons to eat because we do not want the state to raise grain. Here I encounter the most popular fallacy of our times. It is not considered sufficient that the law should be just; it must be philanthropic. Nor is it sufficient that the law should guarantee to every citizen the free and inoffensive use of his faculties for physical, intellectual, and moral self-improvement. Instead, it is demanded that the law should directly extend welfare, education, and morality throughout the nation. Claude Frédéric Bastiat (1801-1850)

Topic.Title: Obama is Gods plan for America !

Message.Msg: Stick - "don't you get high and mighty with me; We all know where the rich man is going (thought you read the good book)... and it doesn't matter who is Obama's master... The only thing that matters is what bb...?" Here is a list of some of the richest men in Biblical history: Solomon, David, Saul, Abraham, Lazarus (raised from the dead by Jesus), and Job. By your reckoning, I gather, simply by being wealthy, such a person therefore goes to hell. Yet, the "good book", as you call it, that is, the Word of God, says no such thing. And Abraham was certainly in heaven when the unredeemed "rich" man was in torments in hell. And God counted Job, the richest man in the neighborhood at the time, as "righteous" in His eyes. In fact, He said, "none was like him (Job), he is blameless and upright, a man who fears God and shuns evil". When Satan accused Job before the Lord, there was no discussion of Job's wealth. In fact, Job's friends said that Job was pretty much not a generous person. I think that there is some more studying of God's word that would be of benefit to you. And you will find that it is the "love of money" that is the source of evil (1 Tim 6:10). And, by the way, those folks that vote in the secrecy of the polling booth, poor or not, that have their covetous eyes on other people's money to "tax the rich" (and especially not themselves) and "make them pay their 'fair share' " are exactly what this passage of scripture is talking about. You guys need to look at yourselves and get right.

Message.Title: Sir Paul McCartney is Okay after near mid-air disaster
Message.Msg: May 3rd, 2012 Sikorsky S-76C Air accident investigators have launched a "serious incident" probe over reports that Paul McCartney and his wife, Nancy Shevell, were just two feet away from disaster when a pilot of their helicopter became "disorientated" in bad weather and almost crashed into tree tops, the Daily Mail reports. On May 3, 2012, McCartney and Shevell were traveling back home to East Sussex, England, when the Sikorsky S-76C they were riding in plummeted towards trees as it was trying to land on the singer's private helipad. Luckily, an accident was avoided when at the last minute, the pilot reportedly pulled the helicopter back up and flew to a nearby airport safely. The incident is now being investigated by the government's Department of Transport after the Air Accidents Investigation Branch classified it as a "serious incident". Flying conditions that night were reported as "low cloud base, poor visibility and rain." A spokesman for Air Harrods, the company which runs the helicopter service, tells The Mail, "Harrods Aviation can confirm that an incident took place on May 3 involving an Air Harrods helicopter. We are working in full cooperation with the AAIB which are currently investigating the incident." A rep for the Beatle told the paper, "Paul has been spoken to. It has been put to him, everything. It's a no comment."

Topic.Title: Billy Graham support Romney on Biblical Principle full page ads in the Wall Street Journal

Message.Msg: The Reverend Billy Graham tells of a time early in his ministry when he arrived in a small town to preach a sermon. Wanting to mail a letter, he asked a young boy where the post office was. When the boy had told him, Dr. Graham thanked him and said, "If you'll come to the Church this evening, you can hear me telling everyone how to get to Heaven." "I don't think I'll be there," the boy said. "You don't even know your way to the post office."

Topic.Title: Obama is Gods plan for America !

Message.Msg: "RE; Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich person to enter the kingdom of God. i guess some of us pick & choose which piece of scripture to use... and with 40years of reading you become good at being selective... aint that right bulkyB !!" Stick - You did not read the entire passage.Neither did you comprehend what I said in the prior post regarding Job and Abraham. That leads one to conclude that you are spiritually discerned. So, the "picking and choosing" is being done by you, not me: "(23) Then Jesus said to his disciples, “I tell you the truth, it is hard for a rich man to enter the kingdom of heaven. (24) Again I tell you, it is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.” (25) When the disciples heard this, they were greatly astonished and asked, “Who then can be saved?” (26) Jesus looked at them and said, “With man this is impossible, but with God all things are possible.” (Matt 19:23-26) First, you should note the words: Jesus simply said "it is easier" for the camel, etc. He did not say that it was "not possible" for a "rich man to get to heaven". And second, He further elaborated on the point in verse 26 that anything is possible with God - and in that context, that means that wealthy people, who have placed their faith and trust in Jesus, are going to heaven. It is only this wicked, covetous, and sinful generation that take verses of scripture out of context in order to establish a secular, not Godly, social ethic.

Jason Chaffetz (R-Utah) acknowledged on Wednesday that House Republicans had consciously voted to reduce the funds allocated to the State Department for embassy security since winning the majority in 2010. On Wednesday morning, CNN anchor Soledad O'Brien asked the Utah Republican if he had "voted to cut the funding for embassy security." "Absolutely," Chaffetz said. "Look we have to make priorities and choices in this country. We have…15,000 contractors in Iraq. We have more than 6,000 contractors, a private army there, for President Obama, in Baghdad. And we’re talking about can we get two dozen or so people into Libya to help protect our forces. When you’re in tough economic times, you have to make difficult choices. You have to prioritize things.”

Topic.Title: Just before I began campaigning for Obama I had a 30-minute conversation with God...

Message.Msg: Majac, Jesus was railing because some folks had defiled His Father's house of worship by making it into place of trade - relative to livestock and exchange of currency. He drove them out by force using a whip, overturning tables, and particularly pointed to those that sold doves. Presumable the doves would be sacrificed by worshipers as part of their obedience to Mosaic law. Outside of the Temple would have been fine. The issue does not appear to be the commerce, per se, but that it occurred within the Temple - as Jesus never did this elsewhere, nor did He otherwise complain about it. If you study in the Old Testament (i.e., Exodus and Leviticus) the somber and reverent discussions of how one was to approach and enter the Temple (and Tabernacle), it would have been unthinkable for someone to be selling anything - whether or not in support of worship - within those confines. This is precisely the reason why Christians should not, by virtue of these examples, make the church a place of commerce. BB
